channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-5100] Server does not start when transaction subsystem configures journal object store
item.description:
Currently when object store is configured to use journal to save the txn log the server won't start.

For WFLY 10.Beta1 there is trouble of attributes naming - see WFLY-5078. But either when used old naming [1] (hornetq instead of activemq) the server fails to start [2].
For WFLY 10.CR1 the naming works fine and use-journal-store works when used via jboss-cli.sh but the server starts still with the errors.

[1]

/subsystem=transactions:write-attribute(name=use-journal-store, value=true)

[2]

ERROR [org.jboss.msc.service.fail] (MSC service thread 1-1) MSC000001: Failed to start service jboss.txn.ArjunaRecoveryManager: org.jboss.msc.service.StartException in service jboss.txn.ArjunaRecoveryManager: Failed to start service

 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
 
Caused by: com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.exceptions.FatalError: ARJUNA012135: Could not create Store type: com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.objectstore.hornetq.HornetqObjectStoreAdaptor

 at com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.common.RecoveryEnvironmentBean.getRecoveryModules(RecoveryEnvironmentBean.java:444)
 
 at com.arjuna.ats.internal.arjuna.recovery.PeriodicRecovery.loadModules(PeriodicRecovery.java:865)

 at org.jboss.msc.service.ServiceControllerImpl$StartTask.run(ServiceControllerImpl.java:1881)
 
 ... 3 more

WFLYCTL0186:   Services which failed to start:      service jboss.txn.ArjunaRecoveryManager: org.jboss.msc.service.StartException in service jboss.txn.ArjunaRecoveryManager: Failed to start service

The reason is explained in comment
https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WFLY-5078?focusedCommentId=13098047#comment-13098047
item.summary: Server does not start when transaction subsystem configures journal object store

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Amos,

It looks like this is merged - can it be marked fixed?

Thanks,
Tom

Working either with WFLY 10.CR1 or the latest compiled version from upstream I still hit this issue. After adding attribut <use-journal-store/> (either directly to xml or via cli) the server starts with several errors.

Changing the priority to blocker as it's important feature of jboss transaction subsystem which were supported in older EAP release.

Hi Ondra,

Please can you update the description as I think the instructions relating to use-hornetq-store may be out of date?

Also, if possible please can you attach a standalone.xml so I can be sure we are looking at the same thing?

Many thanks!
Tom

I've taken the standalone.xml from WFLY built a few whiles ago from github upstream.

The only change that was done, in comparision with supplied configuratioin, was adding element use-journal-store under transaction subsystem. I have the same experience when doing so via cli /subsystem=transactions:write-attribute(name=use-journal-store, value=true)

Hi Tom,

I've attached the config file. I've proceeded with configuration in the same way how the use-hornetq-store worked in EAP6. Maybe I've skipped some step now?

Thanks for checking this
It looks like that it's missing some classes and I'm investigating.

org/apache/activemq/artemis/core/journal/SequentialFileFactory.class has been changed to
org/apache/activemq/artemis/core/io/SequentialFileFactory.class when activemq-artimes upgrades from 1.0.0 to 1.1.0-wildfly-6

So I think we need to change in narayana at first. I create JBTM-2523 for fixing this issue.

Hi Ondra,

I just create JBTM-2525 to add a test for use-journal-store in our CI script. Can you share any similar test script if possible ?

Thanks,
Amos

Hi Amos,

we do not have directly some cli script that we would run to test. We have rather testsuites where we try to set it up.

What do you think, would not be better to add a testcase for the journal types and other basic transaction subsystem settings to WFLY testsuite, probably under testsuite/integration/basic/src/test/java/org/jboss/as/test/integration/transaction/management? Similarly there are already tests like integration/basic/src/test/java/org/jboss/as/test/integration/ejb/management
or integration/basic/target/test-classes/org/jboss/as/test/integration/jpa/hibernate/management.

Ondra

Thanks Ondra, I will take a look at it.

For fixing the issue, it needs to upgrade the narayana version to 5.2.5.Final which contains the fix of JBTM-2523

Hi Ondra,

The narayana version has upgrade to 5.2.5.Final. I check on my machine that it works now. can you confirm that the issue resolved ?

Hi Amos,

I've done a quick check and it seems working for me. Thank you for the fix.

I have just a small question here. Directory of transaction object store is named standalone/data/tx-object-store/HornetqObjectStore/. Is this intended? Maybe it should be renamed to JournalObjectStore but it's rather a cosmetic issue.
